page.title: 11PARISH COUNCIL K.SEYMOUR
page.content: Any parish with an electorate of more than 200 souls,that is people over the age of eighteen,have a parish council, elected from residents.Parish councillors are elected for a period of three years.Kingston Seymour has a council of seven members which meets bi_monthly.Meetings are open to the press and public. It is the responsibility of the Parish Council to represent the views of the parishioners on planning matters to the District Council, and ensure both the District and County Council are aware of any problems that may arise. The Parish Council may also raise a small rate to cover such things as the maintainance of bus shelters and grass verges.The area is represented on the Woodspring District Council by three councillors and on Avon County Council by one.
